content: Stream created by Jelle Herold.
Hi there @Jelle Herold! Was your creation of this stream intentional?

[Mod] Morgan Rogers said:

Hi there Jelle Herold! Was your creation of this stream intentional?

Yes. Our tool is deeply based on applied CT

No doubt, but your tool might be better-served as a topic in an existing stream, as Jules Hedges suggests. We've had problems with "dead" streams where no one sees the messages because they were never subscribed. This stream currently has only 6 subscribers, for example.
On the other hand, if you had intended for this to be a private stream for those developing the tool, we can change the access settings for you.

Hm, I do think of it as a private stream for developers, but not private :). I suppose we can follow the suggestion, but then we cannot use topics to organize it, right? At the moment there are only about 4 active users anyway. But it's possible that at some point nearly everyone this chat will use it.
Okay! Just let me know if/when you need any changes made. I look forward to seeing what comes out of this :big_smile:
@Jelle Herold maybe you could make an announcement on #general or #practice: software so people see it and can subscribe here
Nathanael Arkor changed the access permissions for this stream from Public to Web-public.

Matteo Capucci (he/him) changed the description for this stream.

  • Old description:

Stream to chat about the process.io beta

  • New description:

Deprecated, use #practice: software instead. Stream to chat about the process.io beta
Matteo Capucci (he/him) renamed stream process-io to deprecated: process-io.
